alert.note: Alert for Olympics (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 2:22PM PST until January 17 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory above 500 feet, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the second Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Olympic mountains and valleys, including Hurricane Ridge, Amanda Park, and Quinault. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on very difficult travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected along the eastern slopes of the Olympics on Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
